title: Laguz And Beorc

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Now, our next target is Mugill. Its gate is already sealed, and it looks like they intend to keep it that way. This won't go as easily as our battle in Felirae.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Yaawwwwn... Beorc are all the same. We will run them down, just as before.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Skrimir, please... Listen. Just this once.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: What do you think, Soren?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: The Felirae survivors will have warned Mugill of our advance. That's so obvious, even you must have anticipated it. You don't have a plan?

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: Do not mock me, beorc boy. Why should I bother with plans? No soldier would cower behind stone walls after being challenged to a battle! We will issue a challenge, and they will meet it. We have no need for plans!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Do you realize how completely absurd you sound? The enemy did not build the fortress so they could stand outside of it. They will not come out of their own accord.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: But-- Those beorc cowards! They will hide from us?! What do we do? I do not know how to fight cowards!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Don't you get it? That's what we're trying to decide! Think, Skrimir. Just try.

intro.speaker: Skrimir
intro.line: No! That's your job, Ranulf! You're my second in command. Think of a way for me to use my strength! Anything else is a waste of time. I'll be training outside. Tell me when you have a "plan."

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Wait, Skrimir!

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...This is ridiculous. I'm amazed that someone was desperate enough to make that fool a general.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: I'm tempted to agree with you on that. But there's a reason he's here.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Never in its history has Gallia invaded another country. We don't have any experience or tactics to fall back on for this. On top of that, our general... well, you've seen it yourself. Skrimir... He doesn't pay attention to details, nor does he strategize. Sadly, it's not just Skrimir. Most laguz are the same. They're arrogant and stubborn. It doesn't even occur to them that they won't be able to power through the beorc forever.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Why isn't Caineghis leading the army?

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: It's not an option. We aren't mobile like the bird tribes. Once we leave our lands, it isn't easy for us to get back. We can't take our king away from his domain.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Well, what about Giffca, then? There have to be other capable generals in Gallia.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Yeah, you'd think General Giffca would lead, but... Giffca has other duties to attend to, so really, that just leaves Skrimir.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I understand. Laguz choose their leaders based on strength. If Skrimir is to be the next king, this war is the best opportunity for him to learn about strategy.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Exactly. Since that's the case, we need all the help we can get. Please, lend us your wisdom. Without your help, this war's outcome is certain.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You can count on us, Ranulf.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: We've told you already. We're here to help.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Soren, say something!

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Well, well. Looks like your strategist isn't fond of laguz yet.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: I'm sorry, Ranulf. he's gotten better, but...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Soren, Ranulf helped us out. On top of that, he's our client. It's our turn to return the favor, and our job to do it right. Got that?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: ...Fine. But it'll cost you more.

intro.speaker: Ranulf
intro.line: Thanks, all of you. We appreciate the help.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Give me some time to myself. I'll come up with a plan to get us through this mess.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Great. We're counting on you, Soren.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I know. I'll do what I can.

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Tch! These sub-humans don't know how much trouble they're causing! We can't go anywhere!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Tell me about it. Just yesterday, we could've gone out for drinks and had ourselves a merry old time.

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Fortunately, we have enough food. They'll give up if we hold out long enough.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Um... Sorry we're late!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Who are you? Why are you outside? The city is under lockdown! You need permission to leave your homes!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: What? Well, that's weird. We were told to hand out food to all the watchmen.

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Wh-what?

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Well, I guess this isn't the place. Should we head back? We don't want the food to spoil...

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: W-wait! Don't go! You don't have to head back. That food is for us. We're sure of it!

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: Oh, wonderful! Would you call everyone, then? I'll pass out the food and drinks.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Looks like the watchmen are all asleep. Great job, everyone.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: The first step is done. Next, we clear out the remaining guards and open the main gate.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Ranulf and his troops are waiting outside for us. Let's go!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Wh-who are you?!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Sub-humans! What's going on?! What happened to the lookout?!

intro.speaker: Rommit
intro.line: Stand your ground! Our reinforcements will be here soon. Hold fast until they arrive!

visit.speaker: Grandmother
visit.line: The sub-humans are attacking us? Oh no! This can't be happening! You're a mercenary, right? Please, you have to save us! We'll pay, of course!

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: AHHHH! A sub-human! You're a sub-human!  P-please! You can have this. Please don't eat me!

visit.speaker: Oscar
visit.line: No, I'm beorc. Just like you. Besides, laguz don't eat people.

visit.speaker: Oscar
visit.line: It's not a nice rumor to spread around. You should really try to be more thoughtful.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Are you...Oscar?

visit.speaker: Oscar
visit.line: Huh?

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: It's you! Oscar, I'm so glad to see you!

visit.speaker: Oscar
visit.line: Um, excuse me, I have to go...

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Don't go! Please! Wait! Oh...

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: AHHHH! A sub-human! You're a sub-human!  P-please! You can have this. Please don't eat me!

visit.speaker: Boyd
visit.line: Hey, wait a second. When did laguz ever eat beorc? Have you ever actually seen it happen?

visit.speaker: Boyd
visit.line: Hmph. I doubt that any laguz would eat such a bigoted beorc, even if you asked for it. You make me sick.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Are you...Boyd?

visit.speaker: Boyd
visit.line: Huh?

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: It's you! Boyd, I'm so glad to see you!

visit.speaker: Boyd
visit.line: Uhhhh...

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: How you've grown... You look just like your father.

visit.speaker: Boyd
visit.line: No! You've got it all wrong! I don't know anyone by that name. I, um, have to go.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Don't go! Please! Wait! Oh...

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: AHHHH! A sub-human! You're a sub-human!  P-please! You can have this. Please don't eat me!

visit.speaker: Rolf
visit.line: But... I'm not a laguz.

visit.speaker: Rolf
visit.line: You might not believe me, but laguz don't eat people. I just thought you should know.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: ...I'm sorry. I was just so scared. I didn't mean any harm.

visit.speaker: Rolf
visit.line: Oh... Well, it's all right. As long as you understand now, OK?

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: I'm such a coward. I can't believe it...

visit.speaker: Rolf
visit.line: Wait...

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: What is it? Is there something on my face?

visit.speaker: Rolf
visit.line: I thought you looked like someone I knew, but...it's just my imagination. I better get going. Good-bye!

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Hey, wait!

visit.speaker: Rolf
visit.line: Yes?

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Here. Take this.

visit.speaker: Rolf
visit.line: For me? Why?

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: I don't know... No reason, I suppose. I just thought you should have it.

visit.speaker: Rolf
visit.line: ...No thanks.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: What? Wait! Oh...

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: AHHHH! A sub-human! You're a sub-human!  P-please! You can have this. Please don't eat me!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Are we clear? Good work, everyone. Open the gate!

end.speaker: Skrimir
end.line: Ah, finally! Soldiers of Gallia! Follow me! As long as I lead you in battle, we will always win! Crush any who stand in your way!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: We won last night's battle thanks to you guys. I appreciate your help.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: You should be thanking Soren. It was all his idea.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Yeah, I'll get right on that. ...Hey, I just remembered. Some of your old friends are here to see you.
Hey! Over here! Long time no see, Commander Ike.

end.speaker: Muston
end.line: It's great to be doing business with the Greil Mercenaries again. And with you too, my feline friend.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Oh, you called them out here? I thought they just smelled a battle and sensed the profits!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Well, we can't fight naked, like you laguz can. I also asked Muston to call on some other friends to come join up as well. You'll be seeing an increase in your forces real soon here, Ranulf.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Thanks for everything, Ike. You've done so much for us already, and now you do all this...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Listen, when we fought Daein, Gallia came to Crimea's aid without any questions. Now we're returning the favor, that's all.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: ...All right. In any case, you guys are a great help. Thank you so much.

narration: The tactics used by the Gallian army prove effective, and like Felirae before it, Mugill falls to claw and steel. Before Begnion can react, the laguz overwhelm the remaining border defenses and cross into the Telgam region. With both defense keeps overrun, Telgam falls like ripe fruit at the feet of the Laguz Alliance. Inspired by their success, the alliance takes advantage of this momentum to strike toward the very heart of the Begnion Empire.

Dukes Gaddos and Seliora are horrified by the speed of the laguz alliance. Banding together with the landowning nobles of the northern territories, they mass their armies in Seliora to oppose the Gallian assault. Using the Ribahn River, a tributary of the might Miscale, as a defensive front, the Begnion forces make their camps along its western bank in the Sestohl plains.

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: No, no, no! On the battlefield, nothing is more important than precision and skill!

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: Nah. Sorry, kiddo. Power is the most important element.

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: You don’t know what you’re talking about. It’s skill!

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: It’s power! Did you practice being this stupid?

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: Idiot meathead!

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: What?! Take that back, you little brat!

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Stars above, don’t you two ever stop fighting? You’re siblings. Be nice to each other. So, what is it this time?

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: You be the judge, Mist. What’s the most important quality a soldier can have in battle?

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: It’s power, but little Rolfie here insists that it’s skill.

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: If you don’t have skill, you can’t hit your enemies!

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: If you’re weak, you can’t hurt ’em, even if you do hit ’em!

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Oh, you two are ridiculous.

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: Ridiculous?

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: Yeah, whaddya mean by that?!

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Skill and power are both important. Only a bad soldier would focus on one over the other.

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: That’s true, but…

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: You could at least play along a little.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Play along? I’m sick and tired of having to listen to your silly arguments! Anyhow, I’m here to give you something. Here you go, Boyd.

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: Hey, thanks!

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: What’s that? A shirt?

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Yep. Boyd’s just like Ike. He keeps growing like a beanstalk! If we didn’t constantly make his clothes bigger, he’d run out of things to wear.

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: I’m too broke to buy new ones. Thanks for fixing it up, Mist. I really appreciate it.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Well, I can’t sew very well, but it gets the job done.

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: That it does!

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: I thought Oscar fixed our clothes…

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: He’s been busy, so I offered to take over some of his chores. Rolf, I can alter your clothes, too. If you want, I mean.

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: No thanks. I can do it myself.

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Really? Well, all right, then.

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: Like he needs alterations! I don’t think he’s grown in years. Right, short stuff?

conversation.speaker: Rolf
conversation.line: Shut up, meathead!

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: Why you little--!

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Hey, cut it out!

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: Rolf, wait!

conversation.speaker: Boyd
conversation.line: Yeah, you’d better run, you moss-headed twerp!

conversation.speaker: Mist
conversation.line: C’mon, you guys…

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: …Oh, and this girl! You’re going to think you’re dreaming! She’s as lovely as the dawn, I’m telling you!

conversation.speaker: Shinon
conversation.line: All right, just show me already. Where is this sunrise with legs, anyway?

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: Wait, are you saying you’re actually curious? I never thought I’d see the day.

conversation.speaker: Shinon
conversation.line: Well, we’re gonna have to hang around these sub-humans for quite a while. A pretty face will help keep me sane.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Hey! You! You want to say that again?!

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: Ahh…!

conversation.speaker: Shinon
conversation.line: Hey, pussycat. You should’ve dropped by after dinner. I’m a generous man. I would’ve given you some table scraps.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: T-table scraps?! How dare you! You scum! Who do you think you are? I’m not going to forget that!

conversation.speaker: Shinon
conversation.line: Aw, kitty wants to play? Sure, I’ve got some time to kill. Let’s dance, hairball!

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: HISSSSSS!!!

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: Stop! Don’t make another move.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: Kyza! You should hear the garbage he’s saying! He’s the worst man I’ve ever met!

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: He’s a beorc, Lyre. Please accept my apology on behalf of my associate. Please, forgive her. Now you, Lyre. Apologize to him.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: What?! Why do I have to be the one to apologize?! That guy was the one who started it!

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: Do you want me to report to Captain Ranulf that you couldn’t control your temper and started a fight with a beorc?

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: N-no…

conversation.speaker: Shinon
conversation.line: I’m waiting… I’d forgive you if you apologized. I am a nice guy, you know.

conversation.speaker: Lyre
conversation.line: What?! Never! You’re lucky I don’t claw that smile off your face!

conversation.speaker: Kyza
conversation.line: Lyre! I’m sorry… Maybe some other time. Excuse us.

conversation.speaker: Shinon
conversation.line: Hmph, I hate it when sub-humans like him act all high and mighty, pretending to be just like us beorc. He’s even worse than the other hairball.

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: …Sigh.

conversation.speaker: Shinon
conversation.line: What, did all that stun you into silence? You look like you’ve been hit in the head.

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: So, her name is Lyre. What a pretty name! Lyyyyyre…

conversation.speaker: Shinon
conversation.line: What? Oh, come on! Don’t tell me the girl you were talking about is that pussycat!

conversation.speaker: Gatrie
conversation.line: Don’t mock me, Shinon! This is serious. I feel it. It’s destiny! That girl and I are fated to be together!

conversation.speaker: Shinon
conversation.line: You’re chasing after a laguz now? Gatrie, I swear you’d hit on a tree if I dressed it in a skirt. Tell me I’m wrong!

conversation.speaker: Mia
conversation.line: There you are, Commander! I found ya!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What can I do for you, Mia?

conversation.speaker: Mia
conversation.line: What do you think? I only come to you for one thing… Commander! I challenge you!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Again? Haven’t you had enough?

conversation.speaker: Mia
conversation.line: Not at all. I was pretty close to beating you, last time. So c’mon! The longer we wait, the less I’m gonna remember about how I got that close!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You know I’m not going to go easy on you, right? Or on anyone else who comes at me with a sword, for that matter.

conversation.speaker: Mia
conversation.line: Good! I like it that way! That’s why I love training with you.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: At least you’re getting something out of it. Titania and Mist just complain afterwards.

conversation.speaker: Mia
conversation.line: Don’t you worry about that! I’ve got the perfect solution.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: What’s that?

conversation.speaker: Mia
conversation.line: Yoo-hoo! Rhys, over here!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Oh, I see. Interesting idea.

conversation.speaker: Mia
conversation.line: He’ll fix me right up if I get hurt. What do you think of that, huh?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: You all right with that, Rhys? I know you don’t like watching allies cut each other up in training.

conversation.speaker: Rhys
conversation.line: That’s true, but… I think it’s better that I know how the injury happened, rather than having someone just show up and bleed on the floor. It will reduce the shock of seeing all that blood, you know? That’s something I learned the hard way.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Well, as long as you’re all right with it, I guess it’s fine with me, too.

conversation.speaker: Mia
conversation.line: That settles it! The scene is set, the arena ready… Prepare yourself, Commander!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Oh, I already have. Get ready!

conversation.speaker: Rhys
conversation.line: Just… Please go easy on each other. All right? Did you hear me? Hello?
